title: Sans serif with angled ends
content:
Does any one know this font?

I’ve included two examples of this font being used.

Thanks

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090828032712im_/http:/typophile.com/files/kellogg_5927.jpg)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Kellogg Inv BW.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20090828032712/http:/typophile.com/files/Kellogg%20Inv%20BW.jpg) | 50.8 KB |
author: adpressinc

comments.content:
If it helps, this actually seems to be a monoline font that’s been widened.

hhp

What do you mean by monoline?

Jeremy

Without stroke contrast - where all the parts are (or rather, seem to have) the same thickness, like in Futura. Take that image and make it narrower until the “U” looks good, then ID away!

hhp

Looks like Meta to me.

- Lex
